dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4935 IH: To amend the Commodity Exchange Act to adjust the period during which amounts transferred by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to the account for customer education initiatives and non-awards expenses shall remain available, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Nunn of Iowa (for himself and Mr. Davis of North Carolina) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Commodity Exchange Act to adjust the period during which amounts transferred by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to the account for customer education initiatives and non-awards expenses shall remain available, and for other purposes.

section.header: Commodity Futures Trading Commission customer protection fund modifications

subsection.header: Separate account for education initiatives and expenses
subsection.text: Section 23(g) of the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 26(g)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A), by striking subsection (a) and inserting subsection (b); and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking $100,000,000 and inserting $300,000,000;
in subparagraph (B), by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting clause (i);
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (C) as clauses (i) through (iii), respectively, and indenting the clauses appropriately;
in the matter preceding clause (i) (as so redesignated), by striking There shall be deposited into or credited to the Fund: and inserting the following:
There shall be deposited in, or credited to, the Fund the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Separate account for education initiatives and administrative expenses

clause.text: Any amounts contained in, deposited in, or credited to the Fund under subparagraph (A) may be transferred to a separate account in the Fund described in clause (ii), unless the balance of that separate account at the time the amounts are transferred exceeds $10,000,000.
The separate account referred to in clause (i) shall be available to the Commission, without further appropriation or fiscal year limitation, for—

subclause.text: the purpose described in subparagraph (B) of paragraph (2); and
the funding of administrative and salary expenses necessary for personnel to carry out the activities described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of that paragraph.

subsection.header: Commodity Futures Trading Commission whistleblower program
subsection.text: Section 1(b) of Public Law 117–25 (135 Stat. 297; 136 Stat. 2133; 136 Stat. 2309) (as amended by section 301 of division HH of Public Law 117–328) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking until and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting until expended.; and

subsection.text: Section 23 of the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 26) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(5), by striking subsection (a) and inserting subsection (b);
in subsection (c)(1)(B)(i)(III), by striking the Act each place it appears and inserting this Act; and
in subsection (f)(3), by striking section 7064 and inserting section 706.
